WRITING.TEXT: Even with Ospina in there too. He's a great keeper, but Kostafi was so good last night that he really wasn't tested.

Xhakzorla works. We need to go with those two until Ramsey is back and proves that he's a better option than Santi. I hate when people say that Santi doesn't have the legs to play regularly anymore because that's absolutely false, and he's proving it. Hopefully he stays healthy.
On another note, kind of alarming how many chances we missed last night. This can't be a problem again this year. At the end of the day 3 points is all that matters, but that could have been 4-0 easily.
Overall I'm happy that Wenger is finally taking the CL seriously and as long as we don't draw one of Bayern and Atletico, we can make it through.
Worried that Alexis will struggle to find space in the box, I'd imagine that Basel will pack the box.
I have a feeling that 5 or 6 years from now we'll be calling Iwobi that "Arsenal through and through" player in the squad. If he can stay healthy he'll be class.
I'm really hoping to see Lucas. I want to see how he plays with the first team against a decent side.
I'm not being serious.
Chill out, I don't actually hate him like that jesus
Thought the match was today for some reason.
Trying to sell high on Sims since I already have Forte, McCoy, and Gordon.

FUCK YES FINALLY FUCK OFF KORY
Edit: Kory, if you're reading this, sorrynotsorry
Edit 2: I'd just like to clear this up, I'm only joking. Thought most people would see that, I was wrong. Sorry if I hurt your feelings.
Oh good. I was worried it might be worse that that.
I ordered mine last week and it says it's supposed to arrive by 8 PM tonight.
I hope the undecided voters watched that with an open mind. Trump was erratic, and Hillary was smart and very prepared.
We need to give Xhakzorla another game. People are saying it won't work but we've only seen one game of them and I thought we played well in that game.
I'm convinced Gruden has Hop on his fantasy team
Duke's block on Robinson was awesome.
The commentators said he has Achilles tendonitis, so we're probably just being careful with him. I think that's smart.

I think we should go with this formation against good teams. The mid-table and relegation candidates stack the box against us, so we need Giroud for those games. But I think Alexis playing in this role will work great against teams that are more open at the back against us.

WRITING.TITLE: 3 Pros and 3 Cons From Today
WRITING.TEXT:
I'll start it off.
Pros 1. Cousins, proved the haters wrong with a solid performance 2. Hopkins was spot on today. Feels great to finally have a good kicker. 3. I thought the team as a whole showed a lot of passion today. They seemed like they wanted to win. Baker even got into an argument with Barry, I love to see players speak up. Su'a is insanely passionate, and I love that.
Cons 1. Run defense was horrible yet again. Our linebackers are virtually nonexistent on running plays. 2. Red Zone. Play calling MUST get better in the red zone. It's ridiculous. 3. There were a ton of injuries today. I'm concerned about depth, hopefully we address that during the week.
Was referring more to the kicking and kickoff aspects
It's such a relief to finally have confidence in our special teams.
We might need to sign a lineman, hopefully Breeland's ankle isn't too bad. Didn't look broken when it happened, but he did get carted off.
I lost it when they threw that to Crowder haha
Play-calling
Obviously it sucks to lose Hall, and no one would wish injuries on anyone. But I did think our secondary played better without him.
Our offense was outstanding today. Defense even stepped it up a bit.
T
So satisfying
This game is far from over
Our play calling in the red zone sucks ass
Out here gettin robbed, that's such bullshit
Chris Baker just shared some words with him, maybe once they see how the players are reacting they'll get rid of his ass.
Holy shit. This is easily the worst defense in the entire league. Fucking christ
WE NEED TO SCORE TOUCHDOWNS, NOT FIELD GOALS. JESUS CHRIST
Field goals won't cut it
Well, on the bright side, at least Kirk looks better.
Weakest defense in the whole fucking league. Phillips sucks.
Licht is down...darn
He got blocked into the ball though
A block in the back at that
12 man standard Pick one: Melvin Gordon @Indy Golden Tate @GB Stefon Diggs @Car Charles Sims vs LA
Not really, we have Santi, Xhaka, and Elneny at the moment. That's all.
Uncle Jay-Jay may have taught him a thing or two
That's why we have Giroud.
Alexis is becoming a much better no. 9 as the season has gone on. Perhaps Arsene was reluctant to sign a striker because he knew that Alexis could play it.
My semen is everywhere
I LOVE Walcott's new style of play.
Nut

We needed a more physical midfield for this game, Cazorla is going to get bullied. I'm usually very against Alexis playing striker, however I think the decision to play him at striker in this match could work out. Since he often drifts over to the left it will be him and Iwobi taking on Ivanovic, which could be deadly.

What I'd like the lineup to be: Cech; Bellerin, Mustafi, Kos, Monreal; Xhaka, Cazorla; Theo, Ozil, Alexis; Giroud.
What it will be: Cech; Bellerin, Mustafi, Koscielny, Monreal; Cazorla, Coq; Theo, Ozil, Iwobi; Alexis
The Pats are just too good. They could start a 5 year old at QB and they'd still find a way to win.

Melvin Gordon @Indy Golden Tate @GB Stefon Diggs @Car Charles Sims vs LA
Leaning towards Gordon at the moment, should I be?
I feel like everyone says that about their best pass rusher, but he's legitimately held constantly.
Phillips isn't fast enough to cover slot receivers, hopefully it doesn't happen again.
Not planning on taking it, just wanted to hear what other people had to say.
He also has Rashad Jennings, would it be worth it if he throws in him instead of Sproles?

Was offered Hopkins and Sproles for my Melvin Gordon and Diggs. Thoughts? Not sure how I feel yet.
Other RBs: Forte, McCoy, Ivory, Sims Other WRs: OBJ, Cooks, Golden Tate, John Brown

I'd do that. Edelman is a short target guy, doesn't catch many touchdowns or anything, Coleman looked great but the QB situation gives me doubts, and Dwayne Allen has to compete for targets with a lot of other players.

12 man ESPN standard
My team: RB: Forte, McCoy, Gordon, Ivory, Sims WR: OBJ, Cooks, Diggs, Tate, John Brown
His team: RB: Martin, Rashad Jennings, Sproles WR: Hopkins, Thomas, Cobb, Fuller, Cruz, Austin
He wants to trade me Hopkins and Sproles for Gordon and Diggs. At first I was thinking "OMG HOPKINS?!" but now I don't think it's a good idea considering Diggs and Gordon's recent production.
Damn, that's a beauty
Oh my god, Reed Doughty. That's a memory I want to forget.
I agree, we build through the draft UNLESS a free agent like Norman is available. We need linemen in the draft.
I think Jones needs more touches. He looks solid, so I think if he gets more touches it can make opposing defenses vulnerable to the pass. That way Kirk won't be forcing throws like we saw on Sunday.
We're bad at the moment, but we have the potential to be good, especially later in the season.
That is one play.
Ok but Pot Roast is still a Free Agent

Well it has only been two games, who's to say he doesn't revert back to his end-of-2015 form next game? There are quite a few QB's who haven't been great so far (Rodgers, Wilson) who are elite as well. I think it's too early to come to conclusions, however we should be concerned.
Fuck
He wasn't nearly as bad yesterday, but he has 3 false starts in 2 games as a center, how the fuck...?
Those two plays fucked us. Kirk needed to throw a TD so he tried to force it on 3rd down and it got picked. If we didn't waste two downs we would have came out of that drive with 7.
Su'a looked incredible on several plays, very explosive. I just wish he'd put on some more weight.

Likes:
1. JOSH NORMAN. Easily the best player on the team. 2. Defensive line and offensive line both looked much more solid in that game. Looked like they were actually trying. We got some penetration on defense and our pass protection was stellar. 3. Our WR's and TE's are fantastic.
Dislikes 1. Breeland...don't know what's wrong with him 2. Kirk. He's been really bad so far and he needs to get out of his head and throw the damn ball 3. Coaching. Barry is horrible, simple as that. We're too predictable on defense. As for offense, we didn't run the ball nearly enough. Jones was making a difference but he couldn't get the ball enough. McVay called some questionable plays in the red zone (those fade routes) which really fucked us because it was a waste of two plays. Kirk felt pressured to force a throw because we really needed it on that last play due to the waste of the first two downs.
You always beat us at our place, and we always beat you at yours. Plus we are always better in the second half of the season. I'm confident.
I have a feeling he's going to pick it up. That's what he did last year, and that's what we always do.
If Kirk blows it, I think we'll end up drafting a new QB. The cycle is going to start all over again.
Yeah, don't get me wrong I'm not saying he's bad, he used to be a great receiver, but OBJ is one of a kind.

What I've been thinking about today is: if not him, then who else? Teams don't let their elite QB's just walk, so do start back at square one and pick another rookie QB? In my opinion, he has to be good this year or we're completely screwed. I'm not sure what would happen.

Agree with the first part, but the second part...what?
Victor Cruz has played twice since returning from a two year injury, he's not a half step weaker, he's like 3. OBJ is far better.

God awful play calling on both sides of the field.
We waste 2 downs trying at some ridiculous fade route that never works, then Kirk forces it into triple coverage. Obviously Kirk needs to do better, but if those plays weren't called, we would have scored. Just ridiculously dumb things.
On defense, we continued to match Breeland up against Dez. He was wide open coming across the middle of the field several times, so we should have someone dropping back in coverage. Also, it amazed me how many times they'd run a bootleg and a TE would be open. We finally figured that out, but it was way too late.
Kirk also needs to play better. Simple as that. Missing too many easy throws and making a lot of bad decisions. If he wants the big contract, he won't get it playing like this.
And most importantly, FUCK LICHT. It baffles me how you can false start as a center. AND IN THE LAST MINUTE ON A GAME WINNING DRIVE?!?! Fuck off man.
Missed opportunities everywhere. Whether it's missed TD's or failed 3rd down stops, we need to take advantage of what we're given.
That's who should be facing criticism, but Norman is getting criticized too. I'm not sure why but he is.

10 Man Yahoo Standard
Was set on starting Carlos Hyde at RB2, but should I be considering starting Ryan Mathews instead?

How does him playing on one side of the field have anything to do with his talent level? The defensive coordinator puts him there, you act like he chooses to play on one side. He played quite well last week, especially when covering Brown. I see no hints of him regressing at the moment.
Breeland always plays tough against Dallas, don't be so quick to fire up those Dez's. He's shut Dez down on multiple occasions.
I was only able to watch the last few minutes, was Pogba MIA again?
While reading this I was trying to come up with as many ways to discredit your argument as possible, but I was pleasantly surprised when I got to the bottom.
I don't think this is the whole reason behind his choice, however I think it's probably a part of it.
I love that he's willing to take risks. We've needed more of that.
He's much better when Alexis plays on the left since he tracks back. Ox and Iwobi barely ever.
